title: Rice Bastion
text: Rice Bastion () is a substantial <a href="mountain">mountain</a> mass surmounted by a small crown of exposed rock which appears slightly higher than the plateau behind it, projecting from the edge of <a href="Detroit%20Plateau">Detroit Plateau</a>, <a href="Nordenskj%C3%B6ld%20Coast">Nordenskjöld Coast</a> in <a href="Graham%20Land">Graham Land</a>. Situated between the upper courses of <a href="Darvari%20Glacier">Darvari Glacier</a> and <a href="Boryana%20Glacier">Boryana Glacier</a>, 8 miles (13 km) southwest of <a href="Mount%20Elliott%20%28Antarctica%29">Mount Elliott</a> and 8.8 miles (14 km) north-northwest of <a href="Fothergill%20Point">Fothergill Point</a>. Mapped from surveys by <a href="Falkland%20Islands%20Dependencies%20Survey">Falkland Islands Dependencies Survey</a> (FIDS) (1960–61). Named by <a href="United%20Kingdom%20Antarctic%20Place-Names%20Committee">United Kingdom Antarctic Place-Names Committee</a> (UK-APC) for <a href="Lee%20Rice">Lee Rice</a>, FIDS surveyor at <a href="Hope%20Bay">Hope Bay</a> (1957–58), who worked in this area.
